title: Business Live: Trump drops Fed hints - BBC News
summary: us senate vote paves way for tax reform .
eu27 to discuss uk trade deal .
uk public sector net borrowing lowest since 2007 .

documents.title: good night
text: thank you for joining business live today .
we hope you have a great weekend and we look forward to bringing you all the breaking business and economics news from 6.00am uk time on monday .

documents.title: greenback rides high
text: the dollar made its biggest daily gain in a month on friday - benefiting from the same increase in confidence about us tax reforms that boosted wall street stocks .
the dollar hit a three-month high against the japanese yen - at above 113 yen - and a five-month high against the swiss franc , touching 0.9858 francs .
it was also up 0.7 % against the euro to come close to €0.85 - but it was down against the pound at just under 76p after sterling benefited from stronger uk government borrowing figures .

documents.title: nun too impressedthe financial times tweets
text: nuns tell companies to get real over virtual agms

documents.title: wall street closes at fresh highs
text: us stocks have been breaking records all week - and it 's no different as the closing bells sounds on wall street .
all three major indices finished at fresh record highs on increased confidence that washington will enact tax cuts after a senate vote eased the proposal 's road on capitol hill .
the dow jones industrial average was up 0.7 % at 23,328.63 .
the broad-based s & p 500 gained 0.5 % to 2,575.20 , while the tech-rich nasdaq composite index advanced 0.4 % to 6,629.05 , narrowly eclipsing the previous record .

documents.title: bitcoin boom prompts mining malware growth
text: the booming price of bitcoin and other crypto-coins has kicked off a gold rush among malicious hackers keen to cash in , warn security firms .
many sites are now harbouring code that secretly uses a visitors ' computer to mine the valuable e-cash coins .
the code is inserted by hackers who exploit poor site security or web software bugs .
read more here .

documents.title: watch : where the streets have no name
text: in parts of africa , street names are rare and house numbers non-existent .
most people use local landmarks , like bars , fuel stations and even trees to give directions , but in ghana the government is introducing a digital solution .
from the ghanaian capital of accra , the bbc 's thomas naadi reports .

documents.title: ryanair pilots reject pay offer
text: ryanair says that pilots at london 's stansted airport , the irish airline 's largest base , have rejected an improved pay and conditions offer .
ryanair has had to cancel thousands of flights after it .
it said : ryanair will continue to engage with the london stansted erc to understand how it can address their remaining concerns . ''

documents.title: bmw comments on munich raid
text: earlier on friday , business live reported ( 2.41pm ) that bmw 's offices in munich had been raid by eu anti-trust personnel .
here 's what the german carmaker has to say :

this week , european commission staff conducted an inspection of the bmw group in munich in connection with cartel allegations against five german automobile manufacturers , which have been reported in the media since july 2017 .
the bmw group is assisting the european commission in its work .
the european commission has not opened a formal proceeding against the bmw group .
the bmw group wishes to make clear the distinction between potential violations of antitrust law on the one hand and illegal manipulation of exhaust gas treatment on the other hand .
the bmw group has not been accused of the latter .
the company stands by its previous statements : as a matter of principle , bmw group vehicles are not manipulated and comply with all respective legal requirements .

documents.title: trump close to naming fed chair
text: has us president donald trump narrowed down his preferred candidates to become chair of the federal reserve ?
he told fox business on friday : `` well , as you know , i 've been seeing a number of people and most people are saying its down to two - mr taylor , mr powell .
`` i also met with janet yellen who i like a lot , i really like her a lot .
so i have three people that i 'm looking at and there are a couple of others .
i 'd say i will make my decision very shortly . ''

current chair ms yellen is on the shortlist with : stanford university economics professor john taylor ; current fed member jerome powell ; gary cohn , director of the national economic council and chief economic advisor to mr trump and former fed board member kevin warsh .

documents.title: us stock markets extend gains
text: the dow jones industrial average has extended gains as it heads towards the last hour and a half or so of trading .
the index is now up 144.07 points at 23,307.11 .
the s & p 500 is 12.19 points ahead at 2,574.29 .
meanwhile the technology-heavy nasdaq has added 33.54 points at 6,638.60 .

documents.title: uk 'will struggle with brexit borders '
text: uk 'will struggle with brexit borders '

documents.title: police conduct inquiries into rbs unit
text: police are looking into a division of royal bank of scotland set up to help failing businesses , the bbc has learnt .
officers in scotland are conducting inquiries into the bank unit - called grg - but are yet to open a formal investigation .
rbs said it would co-operate with any request for information .
separately , the bbc has obtained a memo written by a grg employee which appears to show staff were incentivised to extract money from struggling firms .
read the full story here .

documents.title: ge boss : managers will be held accountable
text: fresh from announcing disappointing third quarter results , and a poor profit outlook , ge chief executive john flannery says he wants to change the company 's culture to hold managers more accountable .
he also says he would demand better performance from divisions and reduce the complexity of its portfolio .
mr flannery says that ge 's stronger businesses are being held back by others that `` drain investment and management resources without the prospect for a substantial reward . ''
he says : `` we will have a simpler , more focused portfolio '' in coming months .
we are driving sweeping change . ''

documents.title: oil prices slip
text: oil prices are heading lower in late trading .
brent crude is down 0.2 % at $ 57.12 a barrel and west texas intermediate is marginally lower at $ 51.50 .
gene mcgillian , director of market research for tradition energy , says : `` we 've continued to see signs that the market needs a steady drumbeat of positive information .
`` this week 's department of energy report where gasoline demand dropped to its lowest since march gave a little pause to that . ''

documents.title: no hard sell for the iphone x
text: shares in apple stabilised on friday following rocky trading on thursday over rumours that demand for its recently launched iphone 8 and 8 plus was anemic .
analysts said they were hopeful about the new iphone x which hits shops on 3 november .
but do n't expect a hard sell if you go into one of apple 's stores .
its retail chief angela ahrendts , the former chief executive of burberry , tells cnbc that applpe will not try and upsell customers to the iphone x .
she says : `` internally we said the tagline was 'an iphone for everyone ' .
`` i prefer that we ask you who you 're buying it for .
if they 're 6 or 7 years old , what do they need ?
if it 's someone who 's leaning into something else , what do they need ?
we do that with mac , we do that with ipad , why would n't we do that with [ the ] phone ? ''

documents.title: tech tent : will ai and blockchain be game-changers ?
text: artificial intelligence , blockchain , cryptocurrencies - three terms you need to scatter through your conversation if you want to come across as a tech guru .
on tech tent this week we examine these trends and ask a futurologist to predict which of them will make rapid progress over the next decade .
read more here .
author: Rory Cellan-Jones
Technology correspondent

documents.title: senate tax vote lifts us markets
text: the dow jones industrial average is now trading 108.44 points higher at 23,271.48 .
sentiment has been helped by the us senate approval of a budget blueprint that will pave the way for republicans to pursue a tax-cut package without democratic support .
terry sandven , chief equity strategist at us bank wealth management , says : `` it clearly is a positive and has added to the sentiment .
`` any legislative action that promotes economic growth , clearly will be additive to not only sentiment but presumably earnings . ''
the s & p 500 is ahead 8.81 points at 2,570.91 .
the nasdaq is up 26.85 points at 6,631.92 .

documents.title: muted close for london markets
text: the ftse 100 finished friday back where it started at 7,523.23 .
bank standard chartered ended the day as the biggest riser , up 3.15 % at 772.3p after the us senate passed a budget blueprint seen as a key step towards tax cuts .
silver miner fresnillo led the fallers down 3.53 % at £ 13.68 .
the ftse 250 closed up 15.36 points at 20,146.88 .

documents.title: tech firms to remove extremist posts within hours
text: tech giants including facebook , twitter and google have agreed to do more to remove extremist content within hours of it being posted .
the accord was decided at a two-day meeting between the g7 nations and the tech firms , hosted on the italian island of ischia .
the aim , according to officials , is to remove jihadist content from the internet within two hours .
read the full story here .

documents.title: watch : where now africa 's pension funds ?
text: could africa 's pension funds be used for development ?

documents.title: malaysia airlines names new chief executive
text: malaysia airlines is set to announce its fourth chief executive in three years .
izham ismail has been appointed as group chief executive designate to take over from peter bellew who is returning to ryanair after less than a year with malaysia .
malaysia 's state investment fund , khazanah nasional berhad said that a five-year recovery plan it implemented in 2014 when it took over the struggling business remained on trace .
it was three years ago that malaysia airlines 's mh370 jet disappeared over the southern indian ocean followed by the mh17 being shot down over ukraine four months later .

documents.title: watch : good things , small packages
text: watch : good things , small packages

documents.title: newcastle 'put up for sale in july '
text: documents have emerged which show that billionaire retailer mike ashley put newcastle united football club up for sale back in july , and was asking for £ 400m .
according to bloomberg , a potential deal , codenamed project strawberry , was being explored just weeks after newcastle won promotion to the premier league in may .
the sales memorandum sent to potential buyers show that the club expects full-year revenue to fall from £ 126m to £ 82m .
operating costs will rise from £ 97m to £ 111m .

documents.title: 'no sacred cows ' for ge chief
text: the new chief executive of general electric says that everything is up for review at the us industrial conglomerate .
in an interview with cnbc , john flannery says : `` i 've spent really 90 days an exhaustive review of the company .
`` the businesses , our culture , corporate spending .
everything in the company has been up for examination .
every stone turned .
no sacred cows . ''

documents.title: air berlin sale talks continue
text: could this weekend be a turning point for air berlin ?

the chief executive of the insolvent german airline , thomas winkelmann ( says that talks to sell its assets will continued over the next few days with the aim of presenting a plan to creditors on tuesday .
both lufthansa and easyjet are interested in buying parts of the business .

documents.title: airbus boss upbeat about bombardier
text: the boss of airbus believes it can sell `` thousands '' of bombardier 's c-series jets .
earlier this week , airbus said it would take a bombardier 's c-series jet project which is at the centre of a trade row between the uk , the us and canada .
tom enders says that airbus knows `` how to sell single-aisle aircraft '' .
he adds : `` i think we will sell many more of these planes .
i think we will sell thousands . ''

documents.title: breakingbmw offices raided by eu antitrust authority
text: car-maker bmw has confirmed that eu antitrust staff searched its offices in munich this week , according to reuters .
separately , the eu said an unannounced inspection at a german car-maker was related to a possible violation of antitrust rules that `` prohibit cartels and restrictive business practices '' .

documents.title: ge shares tumble
text: the disappointing third quarter and forward looking profit figures from general electric have sent its share price tumbling by 5.47 % to $ 22.31 .

documents.title: us markets open higher
text: the dow jones industrial average has opened 55.01 points higher at 23,218.05 .
the s & p 500 is up 7.99 points at 2,570.09 .
the nasdaq is ahead 27.21 points at 6,632.28 .

documents.title: power dims for ge
text: ge boss john flannery says that while most businesses within the huge industrial conglomerate reported solid growth during the third quarter , its power division suffered in `` a difficult market '' .
mr flannery will reveal a review plan at an investor day on 13 november .
net profit for the third quarter fell by 9.7 % compared to last year to $ 1.8bn on revenue up 14.4 % at $ 33.5bn .

documents.title: new trains back on track
text: new great western railway trains fixed after software upgrade
who tests these things ?
kobe steel ?

documents.title: ge new chief eyes clean sweep
text: the new chief executive of general electric has revealed his first results since taking over from jeff immelt and , in city parlance , john flannery appears to be `` kitchen sinking '' it - i.e .
getting all the bad news out in one go .
ge 's third quarter income is well below analysts ' expectations and the industrial conglomerate has also cut its full year profit forecasts .
mr flannery says that investors can expect a `` sweeping change '' from his review of the business .
there is room to cut $ 2bn in costs next year , he says , while he has identified $ 20bn in assets that can be sold .

documents.title: sterling rises
text: sterling has climbed higher after eu leaders signalled that trade talks with the uk could begin in december .
the pound edged up 0.18 % to $ 1.31830 .
it is 0.59 % up on the euro at €1.11620 .
although european council president donald tusk said progress was `` not sufficient '' to begin trade talks with the uk now , it `` does n't mean there is no progress at all '' .

documents.title: driverless cars to take to city streets
text: roads in coventry and birmingham are to be used to test the next generation of driverless cars .
a £ 25m government grant will be used to install the equipment needed to monitor the vehicles as they navigate about 50 miles ( 80km ) of urban roads .
the project is being led by the warwick manufacturing group , based at the university of warwick .
the news comes a day after the government gave the green light to build a testing facility for connected autonomous vehicles in nearby nuneaton .
the consortium behind it , led by horiba mira , said it would help establish the uk as a `` global leading centre of excellence for the development , testing and commercialisation of cavs '' .

documents.title: macron says uk still 'a long way off ' on brexit cost
text: before we get too excited about donald tusk saying talks about a uk and eu trade deal could begin as early as december , french president emmanuel macron ( has said agreement on the crucial issue of britain 's eu exit cost was still `` a long way off '' .
`` we are a long way off on the financial commitments , '' he said after an eu summit that agreed to start internal work on the bloc 's future relationship with the uk after brexit .

documents.title: daimler profit drops
text: a number of one-off items - including the cost of making diesel engines run more cleanly - have dampened third-quarter profits at the german carmaker daimler .
net profit fell 17 % to €2.7bn ( £ 2.4bn ) .
daimler spent €220m updating three million current and older mercedes diesel models in europe .
there is an upside : it sold a record number of luxury mercedes-benz models .

documents.title: eu trade talks 'could begin in december '
text: talks about a possible trade deal with the eu could begin as early as december , eu council president donald tusk has said .
the speech given by prime minister theresa may last month in florence where she laid out a possible future relationship was an important signal .
`` it is clear that this would not be possible without the new momentum given by the florence speech of prime minister may , '' he said .
`` i would like to reassure our british friends that in our internal work we 'll take account of proposals presented there .
`` so the negotiations go on and we will continue to approach them positively and constructively .
`` and as we are all collectively working on a deal i hope we 'll be able to move to the second phase of our talks in december . ''

documents.title: tusk : brexit talks not deadlocked
text: the president of the european council , donald tusk , has told a news conference in brussels that brexit talks were not deadlocked .
he said there had been some progress and the eu was preparing to outline a roadmap for talks about a future relationship between britain and the european union .
`` my impression is that the reports of the deadlock between the eu and the uk have been exaggerated .
`` and while progress is not sufficient it does n't mean there is no progress at all .
`` today the council has agreed to start has agreed to start internal preparatory discussions in relations to the framework for the future relationship and on transitional arrangements . ''

documents.title: john lewis pilots 'concierge ' services in store
text: john lewis is to trial a `` concierge '' service in its shop in oxford , the department store chain says .
a `` brand experience manager '' will oversee different services including a `` personal styling service for men '' .
suits you sir .

documents.title: volvo shares hit record
text: shares in volvo have risen more than 6 % , leaving the stock up about 56 % so far this year , after the swedish car maker 's third quarter earnings beat expectations .
stronger demand for it heavy trucks more than offset supply chain costs .

documents.title: nao : update border tech
text: nao uk border report `` too many border , customs and immigration processes remain manual or rely on legacy technology ''
someone at heathrow told me that egates are slow because someone is still physically checking the photos on the passport via the camera

documents.title: spanish government aims for january regional elections in catalonia
text: the spanish government has agreed with the opposition socialists ( psoe ) to hold regional elections in january in catalonia as part of the imposing direct rule on the region , socialist politician carmen calvo said .
prime minister mariano rajoy will hold a special cabinet meeting on saturday to put in motion the process to suspend catalonia 's autonomy .

documents.title: childcare costs rise up to seven times faster than wages
text: childcare costs rise up to seven times faster than wages
yes , and although i got up at 4.30 am every day for a year to commute to @ twitterid @ twitterid as a single mum , i was replaced with a man .

documents.title: talk amongst yourselves
text: the president of the european council , donald tusk , has said the leaders of the remaining 27 eu states have agreed to discuss a trade deal with britain among themselves .
but he said not enough progress had been made at the summit in brussels to move on to the next stage of negotiations with the uk .
theresa may has said she is `` ambitious and positive '' for britain 's negotiations with the eu but there is still `` some way to go '' in the talks .

documents.title: kobe steel uncovers new problems
text: the scandal at japan 's kobe steel has widened after the company said it had found another case of data fabrication , at one of its subsidiaries that cuts and processes steel plate .
kobe steel is also planning to set up an external inquiry into its problems , in addition to its existing in-house investigation .

earlier this month japan 's third largest steelmaker admitted it had fabricated data over the quality of some of its products , provoking a scramble among its customers to check whether their goods had been affected .
earlier on friday , east japan railway co said it had found that parts of the undercarriage in shinkansen bullet trains had been affected by the scandal .
it said the parts would be replaced during maintenance .

documents.title: 'green light ' for second phase of brexit talks
text: brexit conclusions adopted .
leaders green-light internal eu27 preparations for 2nd phase .

documents.title: us tech companies to lobby for immigrant 'dreamers '
text: nearly two dozen major us companies in technology and other industries are planning to lobby for legislation to allow young undocumented immigrants known as `` dreamers '' a path to permanent residency , reuters reports .
the coalition for the american dream will include alphabet 's google , microsoft , facebook , uber , ibm , marriott international and other top us firms , the news agency said .

documents.title: 'balanced approach '
text: the treasury has reacted to this morning 's borrowing figures .
a spokesman for the department said : `` whilst we 've made great progress getting the deficit down by over two thirds , government borrowing is still far too high at over £ 150m a day .
`` we will continue to take a balanced approach that deals with our debts and allows us to invest in our public services . ''

documents.title: budget boost ?
text: september 's budget deficit of £ 5.9bn was the smallest deficit for the month since 2007 , news which is likely to be welcomed by chancellor philip hammond ahead of next month 's budget .

samuel tombs , chief uk economist at pantheon macroeconomics , says borrowing for the current financial year is now on track to be about £ 48bn , which is about £ 10bn below the office for budget responsibility 's ( obr ) march forecast .
`` the obr , however , likely will downgrade in forecasts for productivity , countering the beneficial impact of this year 's borrowing undershoot in future years , '' says mr tombs .
`` the chancellor , therefore , is unlikely to soften the existing plans in next month 's budget enough to prevent the fiscal consolidation from intensifying next year . ''

documents.title: public sector net borrowing lowest since 2007
text: public sector net borrowing down by £ 2.5 billion to £ 32.5 billion in the current financial year-to-date ( april to september 2017 ) - ons
half the budget deficit so far ( 6 months apr-sep ) is capital spending .
the overspend on day-to-day '' ( current ) spending is just £ 16.4bn
that 's still an extra 7-8 % on the standard rate of income tax .
author: Andy Verity
BBC Economics correspondent

documents.title: us senate passes key budget for trump tax effort
text: us president donald trump 's drive to reform us tax rules cleared a major hurdle last night when the senate approved a budget blueprint for the 2018 fiscal year .
this will pave the way for republicans to pursue a tax-cut package without democratic support .
by a 51-to-49 vote , the republican-controlled senate approved the budget measure , which would add up to $ 1.5trn to the federal deficit over the next decade in order to pay for proposed tax cuts .

`` with this budget , we 're on a path to deliver much-needed relief to american individuals and families who have borne the burden of an unfair tax code , '' senate majority leader mitch mcconnell said after it passed .
mr trump tweeted :
great news on the 2018 budget @ twitterid mcconnell - first step toward delivering massive tax cuts for the american people !
# taxreform
you 're going to need more graveyards & a bigger doj .
the suicide & drug problem is about to get a whole lot worse if this is passed .
time to use executive order to borrow money from less important agencies to fund the military .
legal or not they could always complain about it after your out of office .
national security trumps any other concerns .
here an idea .
stop funding war against russia and reduce nato dollars .
nato is probably the source of the anti-russia frenzy .
utter destruction and you tip toe through the tulips in it .
worse than nero .

documents.title: ireland 'uniquely vulnerable to brexit '
text: ireland is uniquely vulnerable to brexit .
blogged :
so they should leave too # irexit
and may very well do when they have to pay all the apple tax to the eu .

documents.title: swiss re takes $ 3.6bn hit from us hurricanes and mexican earthquakes
text: swiss re - the world 's second largest reinsurer - says it 's expecting losses before tax of $ 3.6bn in its third quarter because of the damage wrought by earthquakes in mexico and by hurricanes harvey , irma and maria .
the firm also estimates that the damage from natural disasters has caused $ 95bn in losses for the insurance industry as a whole .
reinsurers like swiss re help to cushion insurance firms from risk by helping them to pay for large damage claims in exchange for some of the premiums .

documents.title: ftse 100 lifted by banks and miners
text: ftse 100 lifted by banks and miners

documents.title: mps to scrutinise brexit risks
text: as we reported earlier , the treasury select committee has laucnhed an inquiry into the uk 's economic relationship with the eu .
mps will be looking at the progress of the negotiations to date , as well as the design and governance of transitional arrangements , and the shape of the long-term economic relationship .
nicky morgan mp , chair of the treasury committee , said : the progress and outcome of the brexit negotiations will have profound implications for the economy and public finances .
the committee will consider the short-term risks to an orderly withdrawal , and the shape of the long-term economic relationship .
firms and individuals need certainty about the situation after march 2019 .
`` the priority of the inquiry , therefore , will be to consider the negotiation , design and governance of transitional arrangements . ''

documents.title: juncker : brexit deal still possible
text: the head of the european commission , jean claude juncker , has said he still believes the eu could strike a brexit deal with the uk .
mr juncker was speaking to the bbc on his way into summit talks in brussels .
he said the eu needed more information about what britain was proposing .
`` we have some details , but we do n't have all the details we need .
but work is going on it 's not my working assumption that we will have no deal . ''

documents.title: no miracles
text: important .

documents.title: treasury committee to look at brexit
text: mps on the treasury committee have launched an inquiry into the uk 's economic relationship with the eu .
it will look at `` among other things , transitional arrangements , preparedness for 'no deal ' , and the long-term economic relationship '' .
the first evidence session of this inquiry will be on wednesday 25 october with sir ivan rogers , professor sir alan dashwood qc , and professor catherine barnard .
business live will be glued to that .
three top experts on first day

documents.title: nissan shares lower after production halt
text: nissan shares dropped 2 % before recovering slightly after the japanese car giant suspended domestic production for two weeks over concerns with its inspection procedures .
earlier this month nissan recalled 1.2m cars after admitting that uncertified inspectors conducted checks on domestic models .
nissan will continue to produce vehicles for export .
the certification process for final inspections does not apply to vehicles shipped overseas .

documents.title: asian indexes edge higher
text: major asian indexes closed up , with the nikkei erasing early losses to close higher for the fourteenth session in a row , its longest winning streak since 1961 .
the index nudged 0.04 % higher to 21457.64 , while hong kong 's hang seng had a stronger session , climbing 0.95 % to 28,426.39 .
the chinese mainland indexes were also higher , while korea 's kospi and australia 's asx also made minor gains .

documents.title: volvo trucks in demand
text: latest earnings figures for sweden 's volvo were boosted by demand for heavy trucks .
in case the world of trucks is not a world you generally inhabit , they include cement mixers , mobile cranes and tank trucks .
third quarter profits were 7bn swedish krone ( £ 655m ) .
it expects demand for the big stuff to remain strong , strong enough to see it raise its expectations for truck sales .
it 's not just volvo trucks that are in demand .
rivals are also selling more of these , leading to pressure on suppliers .

documents.title: role model
text: the bank of england is under fire for a lack of diversity .

nicky morgan , who chairs the treasury committee , has written to chancellor philip hammond asking for evidence proving that `` all efforts '' are being made to encourage gender and ethnic diversity in its recruitment process .
why is it important that the bank leads the way on diversity ?
`` the bank is a role model for the rest of the city of london , '' she tells today .
`` it sends a message that if they can change everyone can change . ''

ms morgan , a former minister for women , said that while her committee was happy to approve the current appointments , she would like to see a more diverse selection of candidates considered in the future .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: australia 's last locally-made carholden to stop making cars in the country
text: australia is bidding farewell to its local car-making industry .
holden - which is actually owned by american giant general motors - produces its final car today , marking the end of an australian cultural icon .
`` we love football , meat pies , kangaroos and holden cars '' was the chorus to holden 's tv ad in the 1970s , which gives us a bit of a snapshot .
ford and toyota have also stopped car production in australia after decades of government subsidies dried up .
holden made its first car in australia in 1948 .
read more here .

documents.title: interserve gets dwp contract
text: shares in facilities management and construction company interserve plunged about 27 % yesterday after it issued a profit warning and said it may breach covenants .
interserve today announced it had been awarded a five-year facilities management contract worth £ 227m for the department for work and pensions ( dwp ) .

documents.title: intercontinental hotels group revenues rise
text: intercontinental hotels group revenue per available room increased by 2.3 % in the third quarter while net rooms growth of 4.1 % was its strongest since 2010 , the firm said in a statement .
`` looking ahead , despite macro-economic and geopolitical uncertainties around the world , we remain confident in the outlook for the remainder of the year , '' said chief executive keith barr .

documents.title: cliff edge 'not the end of the world ' says lamy
text: should brexit negotiations break down - the `` cliff edge '' - and the uk and eu default to trading under default wto rules , it `` is not the end of the world '' , says former euopean trade commissioner pascal lamy .
`` trade will happen , but it will happen in ways which are more costly , hence , less efficient , and we all have to try and avoid this situation .
`` so the only question is : how much more costly will trade be ? ''
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: brexit slow lane
text: it 's thought that eu leaders will say later that not enough progress has been made on brexit negotiations to allow the launch of discussions on a bilateral free trade deal .
but even before any formal announcement , it appears that business people do n't have high hopes of progress .
`` expectations are not high , '' says neil dwane , global strategist at allianz global investors .
he tells today : `` brexit is on the eu 's list , but not top of the list . ''
and this will create more uncertainty for the financial and professional services community , says kirsten mathias , head of policy at thecityuk .
the sector had been hoping for rapid progress by the end of the year , she told today .
author: BBC Radio 4

documents.title: brexit discussions 'a very complex situation '
text: heads of state meet in eu27 format today - without theresa may - to discuss progress in the article 50 negotiations .
they are expected to say that insufficient progress has been made on the first phase of discussion , meaning that the second phase , trade discussions , ca n't yet take place .
pascal lamy , former european commissioner for trade and former director-general of the wto , says :

`` well , it 's a very complex situation , not least because what has to be settled before moving to trade talks is not yet settled , including the rights of europeans within the uk when and if brexit happens .

the bill , which is sort of [ an ] accountant problem - how much you need to pay give that you 've taken commitments for the next years which you wo n't be able to pay as an eu member , so you have to pay your debt , plus this irish question , which is quite complex , so this situation , these issues that need to be solved , delay the big question , which is what is the next step ?
how will , if and when brexit happens , how will the uk trade with the continent and the other way round ? ''
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: hello frankfurt
text: yesterday goldman sachs chief executive lloyd blankfein tweeted indicating that london would wane as a centre of financial importance because of brexit :
morgan stanley and citibank have also suggested they will be increasing their base in frankfurt , says henrietta grimston from seven investment management .

`` if we do n't get these transitional agreements on the brexit discussions , and if we do n't get this ability for banks to be able to continue to passport their services from the uk into other european countries it does very much look like frankfurt is going to be one of the big beneficiaries , '' she says .

documents.title: may housing pledge 'important statement of intent '
text: earlier this month , at the tory party conference , theresa may pledged £ 2bn towards social housing .
but how far would that go towards solving the shortage ?
david orr , chief executive of the national housing federation says :
`` well , £ 2bn will solve the problems for some households , it 's not going to end the housing crisis .
but actually it 's a very important statement of intent .
we 've not had new money from the government for genuinely affordable social rented homes since 2010 . ''
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: good morning
text: last night theresa may urged a new `` dynamic '' in brexit talks that `` enables us to move forward together '' , at a working dinner in brussels .
today , the leaders of the 27 countries who 'll remain the eu after brexit are meeting to discuss progress in the article 50 negotiations .
mrs may will not be at that meeting .
